page.title: 19RELIGION.
page.content: {RELIGIOUS ASPECTS IN OWSTON The parish of Owston, which is combined with Withcote, shares a Church of England vicar with four other parishes. He lives at Tilton_on_the_Hill and is appointed by the Bishop of Leicester.Three services a month are held in St.Andrew's Church Owston. Three families in the village are Roman Catholic and go to Oakham; the village is regularly visited by Jehovah's Witnesses. The churchyard is maintained by two villagers who mow regularly and keep it tidy. The church is cleaned by ladies of the congregation who work on a rota system. They arrange the flowers and at Christmas, Easter, Harvest and any other festival they all combine to decorate. The organ is played by young people of the Parish. Weddings are solemnised in the church.
